from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals
import os
import sys

sys.path.append(os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", "..", "..",))
from validation_utils.lib.autoval import AutovalUtils
from validation_utils.lib.disk_utils import DiskUtils
from ..autoval_exceptions import CmdError

import math
import datetime
import time

[docs]    @staticmethod
    def gen_nvme_smartlogs(logdir, runtime,
                           verbose=False, nvme_delay=675):
        """Periodically collect NVMe smart log data. Arguments:

        Args:
            logdir (str): log directory
            runtime (int or str): run time in seconds
            verbose (bool): print extra information
            nvme_delay (int): delay between log operations"""

        nvmelogdir = os.path.join(logdir, "nvme-smart-log")

        # find how many devices are present
        nvme_devices = DiskUtils.get_storage_devices()
        nvme_dev_cnt = len(nvme_devices)

        # how many times should we write log files?
        cycles = int(math.ceil(int(runtime) /
                     (nvme_delay + 0.1 * int(nvme_dev_cnt))))

        # make sure at least two log files are always collected
        # even in short test runs
        if cycles is 1:
            cycles = 2

        for _ in range(1, 1 + cycles):
            log_time = '{:%Y%m%d_%H%M}'.format(datetime.datetime.now())
            if verbose:
                AutovalUtils.log_info('Storing NVMe log at datetime {}'.format(log_time))

            sm_dir = os.path.join(nvmelogdir, 'smartlog-' + log_time)
            if not os.path.exists(sm_dir):
                os.makedirs(sm_dir)

#            # create directory for additional log data
#            # deprecated
#            sm_add_dir = os.path.join(nvmelogdir, 'smart-add-log-' + log_time)
#            if not os.path.exists(sm_add_dir):
#                os.makedirs(sm_add_dir)

            # loop through the NVMe devices and request an NVMe SMART log page
            # from each one
            for dnum in range(0, nvme_dev_cnt):
                time.sleep(0.1)
                sm_log_name = "smartlog-nvme{:02}".format(dnum)
                sm_log = os.path.join(sm_dir, sm_log_name)
                with open(sm_log, 'w') as stdout:
                    smlog_cmd = "nvme smart-log /dev/nvme" + str(dnum)
                    smartlog_output = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(smlog_cmd)
                    stdout.write(smartlog_output)

#                # get the 'additional' log data as well
#                # deprecated
#                time.sleep(1)
#                sm_add_log = "{}smartlog-add-nvme{:02}".format(sm_add_dir, dnum)
#                with open(sm_add_log, 'w') as stdout:
#                    smlog_cmd = "nvme intel smart-log-add /dev/nvme" + str(dnum)
#                    smartlog_output = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(smlog_cmd)
#                    stdout.write(smartlog_output)

            time.sleep(nvme_delay)

        AutovalUtils.log_info("NVMe smart logging completed successfully.")



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def sel_psxapp(logdir, runtime, verbose=False, switchtec_delay=720):
        """Periodically gather SEL and sensor logs.

        Args:
            logdir (str): log directory
            runtime (int or str): run time in seconds
            verbose (bool): print extra information
            switchtec_delay: delay between log operations"""

        cycles = int(math.floor(int(runtime) / switchtec_delay))
        psxdir = os.path.join(logdir, 'psxapp-log/')

        # make sure sshpass is installed
        AutovalUtils.install_rpms(rpm_list=['sshpass'])

        # IP address fixed for Lightning modules (BMC connected to main server
        # over USB)
        bmc_ip = "fe80::ff:fe00:1%usb0"

        ssh_cmd_front = 'sshpass -p 0penBmc ssh root@'

        # list of commands to gather sensor data at start and end of runtime
        # second element of each list is the log directory
        start_cmds = [
            [ssh_cmd_front + bmc_ip + " '/usr/local/bin/sensor-util all'",
              os.path.join(logdir, 'sensor-util-start')],
            [ssh_cmd_front + bmc_ip + " '/usr/local/bin/fan-util --get'",
              os.path.join(logdir, 'fan-util-start')],
            [ssh_cmd_front + bmc_ip + " '/usr/local/bin/log-util all --print'",
              os.path.join(logdir, 'log-util-start')],
            ["ipmitool sel elist",
              os.path.join(logdir, 'sel-elist-start')],
            ["lspci",
              os.path.join(logdir, 'lspci-start')]]

        end_cmds = [
            [ssh_cmd_front + bmc_ip + " '/usr/local/bin/sensor-util all'",
              os.path.join(logdir, 'sensor-util-end')],
            [ssh_cmd_front + bmc_ip + " '/usr/local/bin/fan-util --get'",
              os.path.join(logdir, 'fan-util-end')],
            [ssh_cmd_front + bmc_ip + " '/usr/local/bin/log-util all --print'",
              os.path.join(logdir, 'log-util-end')],
            ["ipmitool sel elist",
              os.path.join(logdir, 'sel-elist-end')],
            ["lspci",
              os.path.join(logdir, 'lspci-end')]]

        if not os.path.exists(psxdir):
            os.makedirs(psxdir)

        for cmd, logfile in start_cmds:
            try:
                with open(logfile, 'w') as stdout:
                    results = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
                    stdout.write(results)
            # deal with occasional ipmitool failures
            # these errors are harmless and we don't want them to block the
            # entire test
            except CmdError:
                AutovalUtils.log_info("Warning: Command failed: " + cmd)

        for i in range(1, 1 + cycles):
            cmd = "switchtec evcntr /dev/switchtec0"

            psxapp_logfile = os.path.join(psxdir, 'psxapp-' + str(i))
            with open(psxapp_logfile, 'w') as stdout:
                psxapp_log = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
                stdout.write(psxapp_log)

            msg_logfile = os.path.join(logdir, 'msgs-' + str(i))
            with open(msg_logfile, 'w') as stdout:
                messages = AutovalUtils.run_get_output("dmesg | grep -i aer")
                stdout.write(messages)

            time.sleep(switchtec_delay)

        for cmd, logfile in end_cmds:
            try:
                with open(logfile, 'w') as stdout:
                    results = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cmd)
                    stdout.write(results)
            except CmdError:
                AutovalUtils.log_info("Warning: command failed: " + cmd)

        AutovalUtils.log_info("SEL and sensor data gathered successfully.")



[docs]    @staticmethod
    def check_for_bit_errors(nvmelogdir, verbose=False):
        """Check for bit errors in an I/O test.  This function looks
        through the files in the NVMe log directory to find the first and last
        log files.  Then the error counts in the initial and final logs are
        compared.  If they are different, then an error must have occurred
        at some point during the test.

        Args:
            nvmelogdir: location of log files to review
            verbose: print extra information"""

        # find how many NVMe devices are present
        nvme_devices = DiskUtils.get_storage_devices()
        nvme_dev_cnt = len(nvme_devices)

        nvme_logs = os.listdir(nvmelogdir)
        nvme_logs.sort()
        nvme_logs = [dirname for dirname in nvme_logs if 'smartlog-' in dirname]
        nvme_start_logdir = nvme_logs[0]
        nvme_end_logdir = nvme_logs[-1]

        if verbose:
            AutovalUtils.log_info(('Checking for bit errors on x16 Upstream '
                                   'Port and x4/x2 Downstream Ports Lightning'))
            AutovalUtils.log_info('Using NVMe log files located at ' +
                                  os.path.join(nvmelogdir,
                                               nvme_start_logdir) +
                                  ' and ' +
                                  os.path.join(nvmelogdir,
                                               nvme_end_logdir))
            AutovalUtils.log_info(('Error counts are usually on lines 14 and '
                                   '15.'))
        else:
            AutovalUtils.log_info('Starting bit error check.')

        for dnum in range(0, nvme_dev_cnt):
            log_start = os.path.join(nvmelogdir,
                                     nvme_start_logdir,
                                     'smartlog-nvme{:02}'.format(dnum))
            log_end = os.path.join(nvmelogdir,
                                   nvme_end_logdir,
                                   'smartlog-nvme{:02}'.format(dnum))

            # get the smart log lines showing:
            # media_errors (usually line 14)
            # num_err_log_entries (usually line 15)
            with open(log_start, 'r') as fin:
                lines = fin.readlines()
                error_lines_start = ""
                for line in lines:
                    if "media_errors" in line:
                        error_lines_start += line
                    elif "num_err_log_entries" in line:
                        error_lines_start += line
            with open(log_end, 'r') as fin:
                lines = fin.readlines()
                error_lines_end = ""
                for line in lines:
                    if "media_errors" in line:
                        error_lines_end += line
                    elif "num_err_log_entries" in line:
                        error_lines_end += line

            if verbose:
                AutovalUtils.log_info("Checking device " + str(dnum))
                AutovalUtils.log_info("Error lines at start: ")
                for line in iter(error_lines_start.splitlines()):
                    AutovalUtils.log_info(line)
                AutovalUtils.log_info("Error lines at end: ")
                for line in iter(error_lines_end.splitlines()):
                    AutovalUtils.log_info(line)

            # if the number of errors in the log is the same before and
            # after the test, no new bit errors were generated during the test
            AutovalUtils.validate_condition(error_lines_start ==
                                            error_lines_end,
                                            "Check for bit errors.")
